channel.title: devRant Mentions Feed
channel.description: Live feed of all @mentions on devRant

item.title: Lensflare mentioned @whimsical
SoldierOfCode mentioned @whimsical
item.description:
For example, this test message should generate four mentions: @whimsical @whimsical @whimsical @whimsical
('should' as in, I suspect it will, correctly it should only generate one)

item.title: SoldierOfCode mentioned @whimsical
SoldierOfCode mentioned @Lensflare
SoldierOfCode mentioned @whimsical
item.description: @whimsical Oh, btw, I just noticed the RSS feed only reports one mention. For example your messgse here was reported as "whimsical mentioned (at)SoldierOfCode" but does report that you also mentioned (at)Lensflare

item.title: whimsical mentioned @SoldierOfCode
item.description: @SoldierOfCode aww, thanks. I will look in it today, duplication also mentioned by @Lensflare. But I don't know if I can add the "Add new rant" notifs in this rss because it maybe breaks @Lensflare system that depends on it. Maybe I could make extra rss. Will see how far I get :)

item.title: whimsical mentioned @Lensflare
item.description: @SoldierOfCode aww, thanks. I will look in it today, duplication also mentioned by @Lensflare. But I don't know if I can add the "Add new rant" notifs in this rss because it maybe breaks @Lensflare system that depends on it. Maybe I could make extra rss. Will see how far I get :)

item.title: D-4got10-01 mentioned @whimsical
item.description:
@whimsical I wouldn't be surprised if it was either malicious or a marketing move... or both.
'Want to know whether this paper has been written by a human or is machine-generated? _We_ have a solution for you. Subscribe.'

item.title: whimsical mentioned @D-4got10-01
item.description: @D-4got10-01 yeah, you could think maybe, leave it there just like pictures from gemini have a little logo so you can see it's AI.

item.title: AlgoRythm mentioned @Lensflare
item.description: @Lensflare I don't quite see myself working with Swift or Kotlin in the foreseeable future, unfortunately. I do quite like Swift though, maybe I'll spend a weekend with it one of these times.

item.title: AlgoRythm mentioned @Lensflare
item.description: @Lensflare That's the tragedy, isn't it? Excited to learn it, but crushed by the reality that it'll only ever benefit me in personal projects or academically.
